meanings.definition: The action of delaying or deferring something to a later time.
meanings.sent1: The postponement of the meeting was necessary due to unexpected circumstances.
meanings.sent2: The postponement of the game disappointed the fans.
meanings.sent3: The postponement of the party led to some creative last-minute planning.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were on postponement, waiting for the right moment to come true.
meanings.sent5: The postponement of the flight left passengers frustrated and uncertain.

meanings.definition: The state of being postponed or delayed.
meanings.sent1: The postponement of the project caused a backlog of work.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of relief after the postponement of the exam.
meanings.sent3: The postponement of the concert meant more time to practice the guitar.
meanings.sent4: In the postponement of his happiness, he found unexpected joy.
meanings.sent5: The postponement of the train departure left travelers waiting impatiently.
